reviewText:
Don't buy this game... why?
Unique picture to every location" from the store page is kinda not true at all some locations repeat.
In the game it has a themes tab in the settings you can’t use any of the themes. (i'm assuming the game is made in a game maker tool). if you sift tab into the steam overlay it will get stuck there so youll need to restart the game (developer said it was fixed in 1.03 Build). when you do a playthrough and chose a specific path you can just get stuck in a infinite loop.
in the opening scene of the game it says it has a simple combat system… there's no combat system you will get the option to do one thing or the other.
in the trailer it shows some sort of animation in the game yet again there is non.
the images on the store page is literally what the game is."

reviewText:
My full review can be found here: http://www.the-backlog.net/wild-island-quest-review/

Where do I even begin with this game... Wild Island Quest follows the story of a group of guys who are going from their home island (Mech-City Island) to Wild Island while it's on a rare pass-by. While you can go it alone, you can also gather up your friends to go with you. What choices you make determine how many of your friends you can recruit (I did the path with recruiting Conan only).

Interesting idea, right? That's what got me initially interested. Unfortunately, everything goes wrong in Wild Island Quest quite fast. If you're able to even follow the story, you'll find a a lot of English mistakes in terms of grammar and odd word choices. This pretty much tells you that this was translated with a Russian to English dictionary and in quite a few places it seemed they didn't quite know which word to use so they just picked a random one. Of course, this random one" makes very little sense to a native English speaker
date: and in several cases I actually had to go search up words that were used to try and figure out what word/meaning they were going for.\n\nThe horrendous English coupled with the pretty poor graphics (the models just look awful) make Wild Island Quest fall very short of what it could have been. As it stands
recommended: unless some drastic improvements are made
hoursPlayed: this game gets a gigantic pass. There are better visual novels/choose your own adventures out there. Oh and no
voteText: there isn't really a "combat system". You just choose if you were lucky or unlucky in an outcome."

reviewText:
Product received for free

How far would you go to save your pup?

TL;DR:
A short yet charming indie visual novel with different endings depending on what options you choose. The achievements are exceptionally easy, which should just take under an hour to complete. The story itself isn't particularly memorable, but has an intresting concept. Despite this the price isn't worth it, not even for the achievements or card drops. Playing the game will give you 3/5 card drops.

Review:
You're approaching the edge of the island as the "Wild Island" floats closer
date: now only a jump away. Your friends beckon you to come over
recommended: before the opportunity is stolen from you. Taking a deep breath

reviewText:
3.3/10 - Visual Novel on the Lower End of the Spectrum.

I didn't hate this game but it's definitely of lower quality in both depth of story and graphics. You can complete this game rather quickly and 100% the game in an hour or two. The graphics have a wide range of polish; the city was really well done... the Wild Island" floating looked like garbage. Odd photos added into the game to pay tribute to its Russian Comrade creators.

Once in a generation the wild floating island orbits close to the mainland. While witnessing this majestic your poor pup jumps the distance and vanishes into the woods of Wild Island. You have no choice but to follow and retrieve your dog at any cost...

Worth $0.50-2. I'd only grab on HEAVY discount. If you are new to Visual Novels please don't play this first.

reviewText: This is not a GOOD game, at all.  It's a Choose Your Own Adventure broken down to its core, but the art is crap and story not particularly engaging (nothing really happens).  Check some screenshots of the game and you'll immediately understand the overall quality you're dealing with for the product.\n\nYet still, it is kind of charming in a weird way.  I guess what I mean is, I had fun with it despite it not being a good game.  Buy this for a dollar or grab it in a bundle or something, and it's worth the TIME you'll spend on it (less than an hour) just potentially not the MONEY (if you don't buy it at 75%+ off!)

reviewText:
This is not a good game, even for a small indie developer. I do recognize, however, their effort to do something different. Here are my thoughts:

Pros

- Nice enough scenarios (for a visual novel)
- Some cool sound effects
- Bizarre scenes that make you laugh

Cons

- Badly translated, with many glaring grammar and word-choice issues
- Weird luck system that does not add anything to the game
- Too short
- Not much content, even if you choose different paths

Given a decent proofreading service and using criticism to do something better, this game could be half-decent. As it is, now, it may be a fun litle ride, but not something worth any money, so I have to give it a thumbs down.

Note: I played this game a couple of times to see different paths/endings, but most of my time in the game (more than 3 hours) was iddling it for cards

reviewText: I just can't force myself to play this visual novel of static 3d pictures in the millenium-era art style screaming 'amateur'. It reminds me of VRML technology good-old times - crude modelling, plain textures. The music is simple and repetitive as well. The piece of children's literature tells us about a group of teenagers who went on a trip from their urban floating island to a mysterious wild nature floating island with the goal of having trouble, you have to make their few choices in written dialogues. Shall our heroes overcome all the hardships and triumph over the wildlings? I'll never know that, I swear..\n\nПросто не могу себя заставить сыграть в этот наглядный роман из статичных трехмерных картин в духе эпохи смены тысячелетий, кричаще любительских. Напоминает мне о старых-добрых временах технологии программирования виртуальных пространств при помощи сетевого кода - грубые модели, гладкие текстуры. Музыка также проста и надоедлива.  Эта детская литература повествует о группе подростков, отправившихся со своего городского летучего острова на летучий остров дикой природы с целью нажить проблем, а вам предстоит делать за них скудные выборы в письменных диалогах. Сумеют ли наши герои превозмочь трудности и победить дикарей? Я этого никогда не узнаю, клянусь...

reviewText:
This game could be better, but won't be developed further, apparently.
Pros: the player's choises really affect the story, the consequences of the choice is logical and understandable, the story itself is fine.
Cons: roughly made interface, no intrigue or plot twists, playing through all of the options will take about an hour.
Overall: not a bad game from somewhere around the 90s, to spend your evening playing. Taking with a discount is recomended.
PS genre is choose your own adventure" rather than visual novel as written by some users.

reviewText:
Indie, short, easy, limited multiple endings, visual novel.

Inanimate screens overlaid with several rounds of text, lead to a couple of choices, rinse and repeat a few times until story completes. Main part of the text and ending do not change. The graphics appear quite dated and I found the background music irritating.

Very easy to 100%.

This game is super short - game play time is indicative of dropping trading cards only.

I feel the lowest historical price of £0.79 on Steam is more appropriate for this title. This game has been cheaply bundled three times so far and keys given away free in their thousands.

reviewText:
Where should I start this review?
DON'T BUY IT

One of the worst VN (and games in general) that I have tried.
Plot is a garbage. Completing game will take you about 10-15 minutes. Finding all routes, endings and achievements - less than 1 hour.
When I was waiting for last card drop I spend half hour on watching fly that was trying to escape by closed window - it was more entertaining than this game.

If it was just a novel - i would say that it was bad. But unfortunatelly there is also \visual" part. Just look at the screenshots. I don't want to describe this abomination.

Can't say much about soundtrack - It was so awful that I had to turn it off after less than one minute.


Summary:
If you are Achievement hunter without dignity - buy it. Easy to 100% in less than time needed for card drops xD
In any other case - avoid."

Nothing special and a very short game but i couldnt make it better, i could make i even 1000000 times worse. The most act after graphic but this is not game of well known indie game developer with many expierience before and its today a hard fight under so many games. It was a small first step and i stay neutral to see what maybe come out in the next games, if there come some so i give this game 51 % and advise it only to genre lovers that dont act after anything then a story. reviewText:
Forget it. Don't even think about buying. Even for the low price there are many other games....better games, or at last
they are games....this one is not a game.
And the promises? Non linear game....false. The end is always the same. Visit the shed? Nice now you can use one item.Didn't visited the hunter and get his dad's gun, or a lighter...
bad luck, try again. Get the girl in your party...oh, see you get another *option*...but its useless.
Unique picture for every location. OMG I've seen better pictures in adventures from the 90's.

So what's this game all about? Before your grand adventure you can recruit some friends. Doing that with every friend
comes one decision. You can hurry or not. If you choose not....you get an item and your adventure starts. If not, you can
recruit another friend. After your adventure starts there are many *cough* decisions for you. Sleep in the trees? In a self made hut or a cave. Make fire. Shoot a beast. Every one depends if you have the *right* friend with you (and the item).
After that there are 2 more screens with different options.
And than its over.
You may think I played it wrong....well I played it 7 times (under 1/2 hour) and I feel cheated.

reviewText: Listen. A lot of my reviews are normally tongue-in-cheek or weird offbeat satire about what I really think about the game, DLC, or other applicable categories for products on the Steam content distribution program. This is a vastly different situation. No other game on Steam has given me ringworm before. This gave me ringworm. I cannot stress this enough: This particular game called Wild Island Quest has somehow been enough of a blight on my computer that it produced physical ringworms and dispensed them into my body. I also feel as if a large portion of my blood has either dissipated into the atmosphere via my pores or has otherwise been stolen from me in a sudden and rather horrifying manner by this downloadable content. I fear that I may not have enough time to write my final will and testament, so I am pleading with you all to inform my family that when they find my dessicated husk of a body coated in plague flies, gripping my keyboard and mouse in rigor mortis, that I love them very much and did not wish for my death to come in this manner.
